page.title: 08Tan-y-Groes/Sarnau, Ecology
page.content: Stone & earth{banks}divide many of the fields in this gently undulating landscape. They are topped by{hedges of mixed hawthorn, hazel and gorse, with larger{trees}appearing at intervals. These are largely oak and ash with some chestnut. The occasional fir and willow are mainly associated with houses or farm entrances. There is an increasing tendency for farmers to replace the large banks & hedges with smaller modern{post and wire {fencing}in some parts - mainly where arable crops are grown. There are {copses}near the streams and in some hollows on the edges of fields. The landscape is mainly open, though protected from the{sea}and N & E{winds by{hills.
